page.title: 05LEISURE AND ENTERTAINMENT(a)
page.content: Two local people were interviewed, an 86 year old gentleman and a young housewife. The old gentleman said there was no entertaiment at all in the area, in fact the old people made their own entertaiment in the Senior Citizens common room attached to the new flats or bungalows. There were only the pubs and the local club where people could play 'bingo'. In the pubs the games of darts, dominoes and cribbage were played on a competitive basis between the pubs, they also had a league in which points for games were added up and the public house that at the end of the season ended up at the top of the league plus runners up received money prizes plus trophies for the various games and was "very competitive".
